duties_responsibilities.duty: Complete screenings and assessments for various populations to provide linkage and referrals to mental health services.
Conduct specialized case management, crisis intervention, advocacy, and training for clients.
Maintain and update clinical knowledge, complete case documentation, and provide care coordination as needed.
Work cooperatively with other disciplines, agencies, and community providers to ensure timely and accurate service provision.
Participate in staff meetings, in-service trainings, and supervision with Clinical Supervisor.
Serves on mental health or community-based committees, assist in measuring the effectiveness of interventions, and participate in peer-driven training of new staff.
Develop effective relationships with service providers, serve on committees, and assist in the measurement of intervention effectiveness.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Psychology, Social Work, Special Education, Counseling, or related field (Master’s preferred)
Ability to meet credentialing and privileging guidelines
Possession of a valid driver’s license and operable, insured automobile for authorized travel
